intro: Leontodon orarius, commonly known as the yellow puccoon, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairie and woodland habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. Leontodon orarius is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally by Indigenous peoples for various health purposes.
